summary.overview: The CU01 transaction provides user administration functionality for the CardDemo application, allowing authorized administrators to add new users to the system. It includes comprehensive user input validation, security file management, and navigation controls to maintain system security and data integrity.
business_functions: Initial Program Entry - Handle program initialization and determine if this is first entry or re-entry
Screen Display Setup - Initialize and display the user addition screen with header information
User Input Reception - Receive user input from the screen including function key presses
Function Key Processing - Process different function keys (Enter, PF3-Return, PF4-Clear, Invalid keys)
Input Field Validation - Validate that all required fields (First Name, Last Name, User ID, Password, User Type) are not empty
User Data Preparation - Prepare user security data structure with validated input fields
Duplicate User Check - Handle duplicate user ID scenarios and display appropriate error messages
User Record Creation - Write new user record to the USRSEC security file
Success Confirmation - Display success message when user is successfully added
Error Message Display - Display validation errors and file operation errors to user
Screen Field Initialization - Clear all input fields and reset screen for new user entry
Navigation Control - Handle navigation back to previous screens (sign-on or admin menu)
Header Information Population - Populate screen header with current date, time, transaction and program information

CU01.program_overview: Manages user addition functionality with input validation and security file updates
Provides administrative menu interface for admin users
Handles user authentication and sign-on processing
Provides main menu interface for regular users

datasource_summary.name: User Security File (USRSEC)
datasource_summary.function: Manages user security information including user credentials for authentication and storage of new user profiles with details such as user ID, password, first name, last name, and user type for both regular and administrative users
